title: Relates to establishing a credit for employers for wages associated with information technology security employees, and a deduction for businesses for certain expenses
summary: Establishes tax credits for employers for wages associated with information technology security employees, and a deduction for businesses for the expenses of certain other security-related measures relating to information technology.

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to establishing  a  credit  for
         employers  for  wages  associated with information technology security
         employees, and providing a deduction for businesses for  the  expenses
         of certain other security-related measures

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The tax law is amended by adding a new section 35  to  read
    2  as follows:
    3    S  35.  INFORMATION  TECHNOLOGY SECURITY WAGE CREDIT. (A) ALLOWANCE OF
    4  CREDIT. A TAXPAYER WHICH IS SUBJECT TO TAX UNDER ARTICLE  NINE-A,  TWEN-
    5  TY-TWO,  THIRTY-TWO,  OR THIRTY-THREE OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL BE ALLOWED A
    6  CREDIT AGAINST SUCH TAX, PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS REFERENCED IN SUBDI-
    7  VISION (E) OF THIS SECTION, TO BE COMPUTED AS  PROVIDED  IN  SUBDIVISION
    8  (D) OF THIS SECTION.
    9    (B)  QUALIFIED  EMPLOYEE.  THE  TERM "QUALIFIED EMPLOYEE" SHALL MEAN A
   10  PERSON HIRED AND EMPLOYED FOR THE SOLE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING  INFORMATION
   11  TECHNOLOGY SECURITY.
   12    (C) QUALIFIED INFORMATION SECURITY WAGES. THE TERM "QUALIFIED INFORMA-
   13  TION  SECURITY  WAGES"  SHALL  MEAN  THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THE SALARIES OR
   14  WAGES PAID TO QUALIFIED EMPLOYEES DURING A TAXABLE YEAR.
   15    (D) AMOUNT OF CREDIT. THE AMOUNT  OF  THE  CREDIT  SHALL  EQUAL  FIFTY
   16  PERCENT OF THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF QUALIFIED INFORMATION SECURITY WAGES PAID
   17  TO QUALIFIED EMPLOYEES.
   18    (E)  CROSS-REFERENCES.  FOR  APPLICATION OF THE CREDIT PROVIDED FOR IN
   19  THIS SECTION, SEE THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER:
   20    (1) SUBDIVISION FORTY-THREE OF SECTION TWO HUNDRED TEN OF  THIS  CHAP-
   21  TER;
   22    (2) SUBSECTION (SS) OF SECTION SIX HUNDRED SIX OF THIS CHAPTER;

    6  amended by adding a new subparagraph 18 to read as follows:

    8  SION.
    9    S 3. Subdivision 9 of section 208 of the tax law is amended by  adding
   10  a new paragraph (r) to read as follows:
   11    (R)  (A)  FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS PARAGRAPH THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL
   12  HAVE THE FOLLOWING DEFINITIONS:
   13    (I) "BUSINESS" MEANS BOTH PRIVATE AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT BUSINESSES.
   14    (II) "INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY  SECURITY  SOFTWARE  OR  HARDWARE"  MEANS
   15  COMPUTER  SOFTWARE  OR HARDWARE THAT IS USED TO PROTECT AGAINST COMPUTER
   16  VIRUSES, WORMS OR DELETERIOUS INSTRUCTIONS AND SOFTWARE OR PRODUCTS THAT
   17  PROTECT AGAINST COMPUTER HACKING OR COMPUTER WORMS OR VIRUSES.
   18    (B) ANY BUSINESS THAT PURCHASES AND  INSTALLS  INFORMATION  TECHNOLOGY
   19  SOFTWARE  OR HARDWARE MAY DEDUCT FIFTY PERCENT OF THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE
   20  EXPENSES RELATED TO THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF  SUCH  SOFTWARE  OR
   21  HARDWARE WITHIN THE APPLICABLE TAXABLE YEAR.
   22    (C)  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS DEEMED
   23  NECESSARY TO CARRY OUT THE  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS  PARAGRAPH  BY  JANUARY
   24  FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE.
   25    (D)  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS  PARAGRAPH SHALL APPLY TO TAXABLE YEARS
   26  BEGINNING ON AND AFTER JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE.
   27    S 4. Section 210 of the tax law is amended by adding a new subdivision
   28  43 to read as follows:
   29    43. INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SECURITY  WAGE  CREDIT.  (A)  ALLOWANCE  OF
   30  CREDIT. A TAXPAYER SHALL BE ALLOWED A CREDIT, TO BE COMPUTED AS PROVIDED
   31  IN  SECTION  THIRTY-FIVE  OF  THIS CHAPTER, AGAINST THE TAXES IMPOSED BY
   32  THIS ARTICLE.
   33    (B) APPLICATION OF CREDIT. THE CREDIT ALLOWED UNDER  THIS  SUBDIVISION
   34  FOR  ANY TAXABLE YEAR SHALL NOT REDUCE THE TAX DUE FOR SUCH YEAR TO LESS
   35  THAN THE HIGHER OF THE AMOUNTS PRESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPHS (C) AND  (D)  OF
   36  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  THIS  SECTION.  HOWEVER,  IF  THE AMOUNT OF CREDIT
   37  ALLOWED UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION FOR ANY TAXABLE YEAR REDUCES THE  TAX  TO
   38  SUCH  AMOUNT,  ANY  AMOUNT OF CREDIT THUS NOT DEDUCTIBLE IN SUCH TAXABLE
   39  YEAR SHALL BE TREATED AS  AN  OVERPAYMENT  OF  TAX  TO  BE  CREDITED  OR
   40  REFUNDED  IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH  THE  PROVISIONS  OF SECTION ONE THOUSAND
   41  EIGHTY-SIX  OF  THIS  CHAPTER.  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THE  PROVISIONS  OF
   42  SUBSECTION  (C)  OF  SECTION  ONE  THOUSAND EIGHTY-EIGHT OF THIS CHAPTER
   43  NOTWITHSTANDING, NO INTEREST SHALL BE PAID THEREON.
